title: Major Scale Formula
description: Learn the W-W-H-W-W-W-H pattern that builds every major scale.

steps.title: One Formula, Every Key
steps.description:
Every major scale follows the same pattern of whole steps (W) and half steps (H):

W - W - H - W - W - W - H

This formula works from any starting note. If you apply this pattern starting on C, you get all white keys. Starting on G, you get one sharp (F#). The pattern never changes — only the starting note does!

steps.title: C Major: The Template
steps.description: Play C major: C-D-E-F-G-A-B. Follow along: C→D (W), D→E (W), E→F (H), F→G (W), G→A (W), A→B (W), B→C (H).
steps.hint: All white keys from C to B.

steps.title: Breaking Down the Formula
steps.description:
Let's trace the formula on C:

• C + W = D (skip C#)
• D + W = E (skip D#)
• E + H = F (E to F is naturally a half step!)
• F + W = G (skip F#)
• G + W = A (skip G#)
• A + W = B (skip A#)
• B + H = C (B to C is naturally a half step!)

The two half steps align perfectly with the natural half steps of the keyboard.

steps.title: G Major: Apply the Formula
steps.description: Apply W-W-H-W-W-W-H starting on G: G-A-B-C-D-E-F#. The formula forces F to become F#!
steps.hint: G to F# using the major scale formula. F becomes F# because A→B is W, not A→B→F.

steps.title: F Major: Apply the Formula
steps.description: Apply the formula starting on F: F-G-A-Bb-C-D-E. Here, B becomes Bb!
